page.title: 11Maud Heath's Causeway,Wilts.
page.content: This Causeway begins at the top of Wick Hill,four and a half miles from Chippenham,goes down the hill to Tytherton,crosses the disused Wilts and Berks Canal,and crosses the River Avon at Kellaways.It goes through Langley Burrell, changes to a footpath along the Swindon Road,and ends by St. Paul's Church.When the railway was made,an archway was built especially for the causeway. In 1474,a lady called Maud Heath left land and property in Chippenham in the care of Trustees,to use the income to build and maintain a raised path so that people going to market could avoid the usual mud.The Causeway is still in use. A tall Monument was built with an effigy of Maud Heath on top,on Wick Hill in 1698.
